meanings.definition: The state or quality of being burdensome or unwieldy.
meanings.sent1: The cumbrousnesses of carrying all those heavy books made my backpack feel like a ton of bricks.
meanings.sent2: The cumbrousnesses of the old machinery made it hard for the workers to operate efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The cumbrousnesses of trying to fit the giant sofa through the narrow doorway was quite a sight!
meanings.sent4: The cumbrousnesses of the bureaucracy slowed down the entire process to a crawl.
meanings.sent5: The cumbrousnesses of the task weighed heavily on his shoulders, making it hard to move forward.

meanings.definition: The condition of being cumbersome or difficult to manage.
meanings.sent1: The cumbrousnesses of the traffic jam made everyone late for work.
meanings.sent2: The cumbrousnesses of the new software system confused many employees.
meanings.sent3: The cumbrousnesses of untangling the Christmas lights always leads to a few knots.
meanings.sent4: The cumbrousnesses of the situation felt like trying to navigate a maze blindfolded.
meanings.sent5: The cumbrousnesses of the project overwhelmed even the most experienced team members.
